info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 5:15PM EST until December 27 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Caldwell County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated continued light to moderate rain showers across portions of Caldwell County that have received 3 to 5 inches of rainfall in the past 24 hours. An additional one-half to one inch of rain will be possible through the evening hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hickory, Lenoir, Sawmills, Granite Falls, Gamewell, Hudson, Cajah`s Mountain, Blowing Rock In Caldwell County, Rhodhiss, Cedar Rock, Lake Rhodhiss, Lake Hickory area, Grandfather Mountain State Park, Collettsville, Kings Creek, Upton, Globe and Edgemont. - Flooding is most likely along Wilson Creek west of Collettsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
